body.p:
Jackson Breathitt County Ky
Sept 3rd 1861
John M Elliott & Joseph Gardner
Dear Sirs

Enclosed I send you a petition to the Governor to get Daniel Akerman pardoned for stealing money from one John Gambill who has become satisfied that Akerman is clear of the charge and so far as I am concerned I am satisfied that Gambill never had the money for Akerman to steal -- I also send my affidavit as to what Gambill stated about the matter to me -- I hope you will present the petition to his Excellency & say whatever you may choose to say to him about the matter --

I also want you to have an act passed giving me the further time of two years to collect my fee bills as clerk of the cir & co ct let me hear from you soon the people are generally well Tell Jenny South that Thomas P Cardwell has had the fever badly though is on the mend
